c74object.name: flowSwing.noise
c74object.digest: Synthesizer with tone-to-noise control and mc based polyphony
c74object.description:
A flexible noise synthesizer with tone-to-noise control, skew shaping, and ADSR. Supports polyphony and sample-accurate timing via mc signals.
flowSwing.noise is part of the FlowSwing package.

inlet.digest: Multichannel gate signal to trigger independent voices.

method.name: mc.signal
method.description:
Multi-channel gate signal to trigger independent voices.
Transition from 0 to a positive value in a channel triggers the envelop for that voice. A subsequent transition to 0 will trigger the release stage of the envelop.

description.p: Modulation of audio synthesis parameters. Each parameter is controlled by a dedicated inlet. A float or signal sets the value for all voices. Individual values for each voice can be set using mc.target or multichannel signal.

method.name: ampCurve
method.description:
In right inlet: controls the contrast between loud and quiet events.
Range = [0.0 - 5.0] dfault value = 1.0
See scale~ for details.

arg.name: Attack duration of the ADSR envelop in ms

method.name: envCurve
method.digest: Sets the shape of the envelop curve.See scale~ for details.

method.name: filterRange
method.digest: Sets the amount of envelop modulation on the filter cutoff frequency.The value is given as a multiplier of the cutoff frequency. For example, a value of 0.5 means that the cutoff frequency will be modulated by half of its value when the envelop is at its maximum.

method.name: noiseA
method.description: The oscillator is a cosine wave whose amplitude fluctuates between random values. A new random value is generated at the start and midpoint of each cycle—when the oscillator reaches +1 or -1—and interpolation between values follows the cosine curve. When Noise A is 0, the amplitude remains at 1; when set to 1, it varies randomly between 0 and 1.

method.name: noiseArange
method.description: This sets the amount of envelope modulation applied to the Noise A value. For example, a value of 0.5 means that Noise A will increase by 0.5 when the envelope is at its maximum.

method.name: noiseF
method.description: The oscillator generates a cosine wave with a fluctuating period. A new random period is generated when the oscillator reaches +1 or -1, at the start and midpoint of each cycle. When Noise F is set to 0, the oscillator's period is constant; when set to 1, it varies randomly around its centre period, with a maximum value of twice that.

method.name: noiseFrange
method.description: This sets the amount of envelope modulation applied to the Noise F value. For example, a value of 0.5 means that Noise A will increase by 0.5 when the envelope is at its maximum.

arg.name: Duration of the release stage of the ADSR envelop in ms

method.name: skew
method.description: The skew factor determines the shape of the cosine wave. A value of 0 results in a symmetric cosine wave, while values of -1 and 1 create asymmetric waves.

method.name: skewRange
method.description: This sets the amount of envelope modulation applied to the Skew value. For example, a value of 0.5 means that Skew will increase by 0.5 when the envelope is at its maximum.

method.name: sustain
method.description: The sustain level determines the amplitude of the sound during the sustain stage of the ADSR envelope. A value of 0 means no sound, while a value of 1 means full amplitude. The exact value of the sustain level is determined by the envelop curve. See scale~.
